message.content:
cs.HC, cs.GR, cs.CYBER, cs.CE, cs.CR 

The paper discusses the use of Virtual Reality and Serious Games for earthquake preparedness training, which involves human-computer interaction and user experience design, indicating a likely fit with the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. The paper also discusses the representation of buildings and their damage, which suggests a possible fit with the Graphics (cs.GR) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of non-player characters and their interaction with human participants, which suggests a possible fit with the Cybersecurity (cs.CYBER) sub-category. The paper also discusses the design of a training tool for public buildings, which suggests a possible fit with the Computer Engineering (cs.CE) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the importance of enhancing evacuee safety, which suggests a possible fit with the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category.
